Learn how to use the Internet in the comfort and privacy of your own home!

NOTE: this Internet / Computer Learning Video can be watched on televisions with DVD players and on computers with DVD drives

#1 in the "Internet Survival Guide" series

DVD DESCRIPTION

World Wide Web basics are carefully explained and fully demonstrated.

Both Windows and Mac computers are used for the visual demonstrations.

Designed and created by an experienced adult services librarian & computer technologies instructor, this instructional video is ideal for absolute computer novices of all ages.

No previous computer experience is assumed or necessary.

"Internet Survival Guide" can certainly be used for classroom but will also be especially beneficial to people who want to learn about how to use the Internet in the privacy of their own living rooms.

This computer help video provides a solid foundation for future Internet education.

Table of Contents

1) Computer Mouse Tips
2) Web Sites & Web Pages
3) Web Browser Introduction
4) Web Page Basics
5) Demonstrations of popular Web sites (Wikipedia, Yahoo!, and Amazon.com)
6) Computer keyboarding tips
7) Where to go From Here

[...]

ABOUT THE AUTHOR
Help for the Computer Shy founder Michael Gorzka has been teaching "computer shy" adults how to use personal computers (both Macs & PCs) and various software & Internet applications since 1997. He has incorporated what he has learned from his teaching experiences into his computer help DVDs and manuals.
